intro: Piparea spruceana, commonly known as the mountain stork's bill, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves that are typically lance-shaped and hairy. It produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
